Description: Body sherd of large Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice with cul; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black, fired reddish; traces of two faded added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of bull (part of one foreleg, both hind legs, genitals and tail of bull remaining) to left; spiked rosette and rising triangle as filling ornament; below, two bands above guilloche pattern on cul.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0541) (phase 2)
